    • isDatabaseReady

      public SC_String.SC_String_Response isDatabaseReady()
      Checks that the string value can be used for database-table or column names, i.e.: Is it not null? Is it not empty? Is it lower-case? Has it no empty spaces? NOTE: This does not check for whitespace-only strings!
      Specified by:
      isDatabaseReady in interface SC_String.SC_String_Condition

    • isPartOfEnum

      public SC_String.SC_String_Response isPartOfEnum(Class<? extends Enum<?>> enumClass)
      Checks that the string value belongs to the given enumeration (i.e. it can be mapped into one of it's constants (case-sensitive).
      Specified by:
      isPartOfEnum in interface SC_String.SC_String_Condition
      Parameters:
      enumClass - The Class object of the enumeration to check against (i.e. for MyEnum use "MyEnum.class")
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the provided enumClass is null.

    • elseBreak

      public void elseBreak() throws SanityCheckException
      Executes the defined sanity check. If the check fails, a SanityCheckException is thrown.
      Specified by:

      Throws:

    • elseLog

      public void elseLog()
      Executes the defined sanity check. If the check fails, a message is logged as a Logger.INFO log msg.
      Specified by:
      elseLog in interface SC_String.SC_String_Response

    • elseReplaceWith

      public String elseReplaceWith(String defaultValue)
      Executes the defined sanity check. If the check fails, the provided default value is returned. Otherwise, the original value is returned. NOTE: Your originally provided SanityCheck.thatString(yourString) is NOT changed. NOTE: It is your responsibility to "catch" the replaced String here, for example with String testedString = SanityCheck.thatString(yourString).is...().elseReplaceWith("something New")
      Specified by:
      elseReplaceWith in interface SC_String.SC_String_Response
      Parameters:
      defaultValue - The value to return if the check fails.
      Returns:
      The original value if the check passes, else the defaultValue if it fails.
